Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Teixobactin (Ile-rich; natural AMPs; nonribosomal peptide, Gram-negative bacteria, prokaryotes, lactone, depsipeptide, XXJ, XXD4; XXM; UCSB1b; BBW)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: A new peptide antibiotic has been discovered via a multichannel device, the iChip, to simultaneously isolate and grow uncultured bacteria.Structural characterization: An ester bond is formed between the backbone C-terminal Ile carboxylic acid and the side chain of Thr8. In addition, the N-terminal phe is methylated (XXM). There are 4 D-amino acids and enduracididine (represented with an Arg here).Activity: Active against primarily Gram-positive bacteria, including S. aureus MSSA or MRSA (MIC 0.25 ug/ml), E. faecalis (MIC 0.5 ug/ml) (anti-VRE), penicillin-resistant S. pneumoniae (MIC <0.003 ug/ml), S. pyogenes (MIC 0.06 ug/ml), S. agalactiae (MIC 0.12 ug/ml), B. anthracis (MIC <=0.06 ug/ml), C. difficile (MIC 0.005 ug/ml), P. acnes (MIC 0.08 ug/ml), M. tuberculosis H37Rv (MIC 0.125 ug/ml) (anti-TB), H. influenzae (MIC 4 ug/ml), M. catarrhalis (MIC 2 ug/ml), E. coli MIC (25 ug/ml), P-aeruginosa (MIC >32 ug/ml), and K-pneumoniae (MIC >32 ug/ml).MOA:bacteria: this peptide inhibits both peptidoglycan and teichoic acid synthesis, causing cell lysis (Homma et al. 2016).Resistance development:no:bacteria:S. aureus: Resistance development:no:bacteria:M. tuberculosis: no mutants were identified on plates at 4xMIC. Resistance was not observed after 27 passages.3D Structure: Solid-state NMR observed the interaction of enduracididine with lipid II phosphate and established a beta-sheet structure, part of the large supramolecular fibrill (Shukla et al., 2022).SAR: One can only increase positive charges to 3 or 4 as an analog with 5 charges shows least activity (Abdel Monaim  et al. 2017). Alanine scan reveals that positions 10 and 3 can be changed without affecting activity (Chen et al. 2017).It is a potential lead.Updated 10/2017; 7/2021; 3/2022; 10/2022; 12/2024.
Literature Information.Author: Ling LL, Schneider T, Peoples AJ, Spoering AL, Engels I, Conlon BP, Mueller A, Sch√§berle TF, Hughes DE, Epstein S, Jones M, Lazarides L, Steadman VA, Cohen DR, Felix CR, Fetterman KA, Millett WP, Nitti AG, Zullo AM, Chen C, Lewis K. 2015
Literature Information.Title: A new antibiotic kills pathogens without detectable resistance.
